dl.dd: Type: one of the values below
You can set the type attribute to one of the values below for a more specialized type of textbox. Don't set the type if you wish to use a regular textbox.

ul.li: autocomplete: A textbox that supports autocomplete. For more information about autocomplete textboxes, see the autocomplete documentation (XPFE [Thunderbird/SeaMonkey]) (Firefox)

number: gecko_minversion_inline("1.9") A textbox that only allows the user to enter numbers. In addition, arrow buttons appear next to the textbox to let the user step through values. There are several attributes that allow the number textbox to be configured, including template.XULAttr("decimalplaces"), template.XULAttr("min"), template.XULAttr("max"), template.XULAttr("increment"), template.XULAttr("wraparound"), template.XULAttr("hidespinbuttons"), and template.XULAttr("textbox.value").
password: A textbox that hides what is typed, used for entering passwords.

search: gecko_minversion_inline("1.9.1") A textbox intended for searching. The command event will fire as the user modifies the value. A listener for the command event should update search results. If the template.XULAttr("searchbutton") attribute is set to true, the command event is only fired if the user presses the search button or presses the Enter key. You may specify grey text to appear when the search box is empty using the template.XULAttr("emptytext") attribute, and a timeout may be set for the command event using the template.XULAttr("timeout") attribute (defaults to 500).

timed: template.deprecated_inline() This textbox will fire a command event after the user types characters and a certain time has passed. The delay is set with the template.XULAttr("timeout") attribute. The command event will fire if the user presses the Enter key. The timed type is deprecated in Gecko 1.9.1 and the search textbox may be used instead.
